bug.author: kellyamanda
bug.summary: st.sidebar is showing under other widgets
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When I have two date widgets in the sidebar it is positioning one under the other. See photo attached. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Place two st.date_input into the sidebar
st.sidebar.date_input('start date', datetime.date(2011,01,01)) st.sidebar.date_input('end date', datetime.date(2011,12,31)) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
When widget is open it should pop over anything else in the sidebar until it is closed. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Shows underneath the other widget. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Unclear <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.45.0
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47222480/64635982-97c01500-d3b5-11e9-88f5-c25063a67e92.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
I can't repro this in Streamlit 0.53.0, so I'm assuming it got fixed somewhere along the way... <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/709022/73317897-966c7900-41ec-11ea-8a3f-105326e89cf7.png></denchmark-link>
(There's another date widget correctly layered under the Start Date widget that's open.)
